title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe displaced hundreds of UMass Boston students from East Residence Hall due to flooding.
About 50 rooms on floors 2-10 suffered varying degrees of water damage, university officials reported.
UMass Boston offers temporary housing solutions, with some students relocated to UMass Amherst's Charles River Campus.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library suggested over 35 books to Boston Public Library after Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to Seahawks.
The list includes 'Things That Make White People Uncomfortable' by former Seahawk Michael Bennett and a children's book by Maggie Rudd.
Both libraries collaborate on Books Unbanned, an initiative supporting teens' rights to read without censorship.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues to enforce ballot initiative granting authority to audit Massachusetts Legislature.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell refuses to represent DiZoglio's office, citing lack of authority for lawsuit.
House and Senate leaders oppose audit, argue existing independent audits suffice; lawsuit names top legislative officials.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, arrested in Seaport on charges related to human trafficking and commercial sex acts.
Boston Police Department and State Police conducted the undercover operation leading to Macean's arrest.
Macean will face arraignment in South Boston District Court following his arrest by Boston police.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Increased coyote sightings in Boston are linked to eastern coyote mating season, occurring from January through March.
MassWildlife advises residents to keep pets indoors and remove food sources to prevent coyote encounters.
Hazing techniques, such as making loud noises and waving arms, are recommended to deter coyotes effectively.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton praised Patriots QB Drake Maye for his progress despite the Super Bowl loss to the Seahawks.
Newton, previously critical of Maye, highlighted his strides to becoming an MVP candidate after the 2025 season.
Drake Maye finished the season as the MVP runner-up, but struggled in the playoffs with multiple turnovers.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP, helping Boston College to a 6-2 victory over Boston University.
Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau, other Bruins prospects, also scored in BC's victory at TD Garden.
Hagens, drafted 7th overall in 2025, leads BC with 31 points in 24 games during his sophomore season.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis emphasizes team culture and success as a draw for free agents this offseason.
The Patriots hold $42.7 million in cap space, allowing potential key additions to their roster.
New England's recent success increases appeal for free agents, with the team nearly winning Super Bowl LX.

title: Sticker shock for a dealerâ€™s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A reader was quoted $1,200 by a dealership to replace a starter in a 2014 Honda Accord.
The estimated cost for a starter and labor is around $925, according to AAA Northeast's Car Doctor.
Dealerships can charge up to 36% more than independent shops for comparable vehicle repair work.

title: Where will Kristian Campbell play in the field for the Red Sox in 2026?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kristian Campbell struggled defensively at second base in 2025, leading the Red Sox to reposition him primarily in the outfield.
Campbell, a former touted prospect, began the season strongly but was demoted to Triple-A due to performance issues.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora acknowledges Campbell's offensive potential, aiming to recapture his early 2025 batting prowess.
